subject: Web3
title: North Korea's Crypto Theft
description: A quick win: understand North Korea's Crypto Theft.

hook.text: North Korea's Lazarus Group has stolen over $3 billion in crypto. They use it to fund weapons programs.

buildup.text: The state-sponsored hackers target exchanges, bridges, and DeFi protocols with sophisticated attack chains.

discovery.text: The Ronin hack alone netted $625 million. The Harmony bridge lost $100 million. Both were attributed to Lazarus.

twist.text: Despite sanctions, North Korea launders crypto through mixers and decentralized exchanges that don't require identity checks.

climax.text: Crypto theft has become a significant revenue source for a nuclear-armed state. The stakes go far beyond money.

punchline.text: A nation funds its weapons program by hacking crypto protocols.

quiz.question: How much has North Korea's Lazarus Group reportedly stolen in crypto?
